qas.question: What have been mined in the Alps for thousands of years?
What did Celtic tribes mine from the Alps?
What did the Romans mine in the Bad Gastein area?
What does Erzberd in Styria furnish?
The cinnabar deposits are found in what area?

context: The Alps are a source of <a0_0>minerals<a0_0/> that have been mined for thousands of years. In the 8th to 6th centuries BC during the Hallstatt culture, Celtic tribes mined <a1_0>copper<a1_0/>; later the Romans mined <a2_0>gold<a2_0/> for coins in the Bad Gastein area. Erzberg in Styria furnishes <a3_0>high-quality iron ore<a3_0/> for the steel industry. Crystals are found throughout much of the Alpine region such as cinnabar, amethyst, and quartz. The cinnabar deposits in <a4_0>Slovenia<a4_0/> are a notable source of cinnabar pigments.
